page.title: 03The Church, Abbotts Ann
page.content: St. Mary's Church, Abbotts Ann, was built in 1716. The buildings have not changed over the last 50 years. The Rev. Michael Tristram is the present rector. Services are held twice monthly, alternately with Clatford Church which is also in the care of the rector. There are services at 8am. and 10.45am. at which between 70 and 150 people attend. There are 30 children in the Sunday School and 12 members in the choir. Volunteers are responsible for cleaning and flower arranging. The Church Hall is used by the following groups: Sunshine Club for old people, Women's Institute, Play school, Youth Group, Mothers and Toddlers and Drama Group. A group made kneelers which commemorate, by name, those who have been awarded 'virgin's crowns'.
